suddenly broke and not openning at all. rolling back to older versions didn't fix it

The errors:
 Unable to show a dialog outside the UI thread message loop: Chromium - The profile appears to be in use by another Chromium process (7) on another computer (dhcp-172-31-18-130). Chromium has locked the profile so that it doesn't get corrupted. If you are sure no other processes are using this profile, you can unlock the profile and relaunch Chromium.

summary: Great app, much better than expected

description:
Even though the linux flavor of this application lacks the full bells and whistles of its windows counterpart (videos, on mouse hover previews) it still delivers the core experience: an immense catalog of music at your fingertips.

Account setup menus don't work with wayland.  You will have to use X if you need to access them.
summary: Basic model of the windows version

description: Great app, would recommend.
Compare with Windows's version, it has no difference.
Hating a bug that wont let me login into the application itself.
I am using it and love it.

It's a nice application really, it's well made and functional. It looks ok, but an integration with the system theme would be nice. Also the application sometimes refuses to play some songs, as if there were network problems, when in fact there aren't. But it's good for the most part
summary: Best streaming service on Linux, but not perfect

description:
The Linux Spotify client used to lag a bit behind Windows, but the current version seems to be up to date. It has been working well without any issues.

My laptop has a High-DPI screen, and Spotify didn't automatically detect or adjust its self to GNOME's scaling settings. This was fixed manually by editing the .desktop file and changing the Exec value to: Spotify --force-device-scale-factor=2 %U
Desktop client as it should be. Nice desktop integration.
Maybe I screwed something up, but it doesn't seem to have one. Also, sometimes it loads weird and I can't scrub through a song. Otherwise, gets the job done just fine.
It's fast and stable. There's no problems with login and using this app.
The app works just as good as it does on any other OS. (As far as I have tested it..)
I want to listen to high quality audio streams and can't open the settings in this application. Very annoying!
summary: Can't open settings to select better quality option

description: Plays on background if closed, a feature that didn't work for me on the snap. Also more frequently updated than snap.

The media keys (play, pause, next etc.) on my keyboard are not working with this version.

Manually calling "mpris dbus api" seems to work:
dbus-send --print-reply --dest=org.mpris.MediaPlayer2.spotify /org/mpris/MediaPlayer2 org.mpris.MediaPlayer2.Player.PlayPause

Found this that might be related (org.gnome.SettingsDaemon should be changed to org.gnome.SettingsDaemon.MediaKeys?): https://community.spotify.com/t5/Desktop-Linux/Multimedia-keys-not-working-with-flatpak/m-p/4560892/thread-id/16776
summary: Media keys not working on Fedora 30 (Gnome 3.32.2)

description:
The app itself is great:
- it recommends a lot of new music weekly
- you can listen to "radios" (that are like "we think you'll like those other songs") created from selected songs
- you can save the songs you like in your library
- you can create playlists
- you can download your library for offline playback (but I think it's in some kind of proprietary format readable only by Spotify, I don't think you get something like an mp4 for each song to just do whatever you want)
- you can listed to songs for free, but you'll get ads from time to time or you can pay 5 euros per month and get the premium version and I think that's a great price

It's the best music app I could find. I'd give it 5+1 stars, because the extra star is for how good this works as a flatpak. I tried the snap version on Ubuntu but it's got problems on 4k hidpi displays. This flatpak version works perfectly.
summary: Great app to find and listen to new music!

description: Have been using it for about a month now and it's not as seamless as the web or native Windows version; Particularly, when playing music from a different device (phone in my case) it fails to sync to the device unless the app is opened on my phone. When paused or stopped, the phone app must be opened again for the Linux application to sync. Otherwise no problems.
I appreciate the little touch of forcing the titlebar into dark mode, makes it feel more consistent.
summary: Really good, functions well, no issues so far

description: I have some graphical errors under Fedora 30, believe it is related to Wayland.
Just works out of the box, no complaints!
I tried other ways to install spotify on fedora and I always found some trouble, but with flatpak it works perfectly!
It's Awesome but need you need to more features like it is on the phone.
Not working at all.
Runs seamlessly on openSUSE Tumbleweed. Thanks guys!
summary: Linux support is the reason I use Spotify

description: Works flawlessly.

So I install it from flatpak through Gnome software. Finally it won't dump the core again..... Days without music is killing me. For supporting artist better, you can also consider bandcamp, which has high quality streaming and one-time pucahse.
summary: The one on snapcraft is broken

description: I have used spotify for around 5 years and always had a great linux support

I'm using Arch, where Spotify is only available through the AUR (user repository) and it's outdated for quite some time. Using Flatpak is the only way to get an up-to-date version. It seems to work fine on my laptop's HIDPI screen too. It scales x2 without me having to edit any .desktop files. It still doesn't scale back to x1 when I move it to a lower DPI screen, but that affects all Electron apps which still don't support Wayland mixed DPI setups.

As for Spotify itself, it's definitely the best music streaming service!
summary: The best way to get Spotify

description: Works as intended, it's spotify.

The UI looks a bit odd as it's mixing the flat Windows-10 like scrolling bars and other flat elements with Adwaita's window decoration, and generally I'm not so hyped about this being an electron app.
However, the music experience and quality is great, and the flatpaked version works like a charm out of the box.
summary: UI looks kinda odd, but overall great app

description: It's non-free and evil, for sure. But at least they support Debian directly and other distributions via snaps and flatpaks. The music side of things is pretty great!
Disappointing and frustrating!

Great app, works pretty well on Fedora, but... whenever I try to change the image of a playlist, Spotify will present a blank modal. Upon interacting with it (closing it, clicking it, moving it) Spotify will crash. Until this issue is resolved, I will be rating this 3 stars.

One thing this app does that the web site doesn't do is allow me to use my keyboard keys for pause/play to control the music. It's a small thing, but I appreciate it. It "feels" like an Electron app, which it probably is.
summary: It does have an advantage over the web site

Dies ist die offizielle Snap version und war bis heute über ein Jahr veraltet. Linux wird von diesem Programm stiefmütterlich behandelt und man merkt es an fehlenden Updates und Features seitens spotify. Auch ich litt oft unter kaputten Werbeunterbrechnungen die mich zwingten neu zu starten damit ich weiterhöhren konnte. Mal sehen wie das heutige update das ändert da es endlich mal eine neue version ist und nicht nur ein rebuild. Trotzdem gibt es leider nichts vergleichbares auf dem Markt, deswegen 3 Sterne.
Worked well before, now I see just the Windows Frame and some flickering elements inside.
What happened with the latest update? It worked just fine before that. Now I have just a window with flickering stuff.
It worked, but since the last update there is just a blackscreen. The Music works when pressing space to pause an play but good luck trying to change playlists.

As noted in many other reviews, I also have issues with the ui being a blank black screen. I could workaround it by disabling the gpu acceleration (device=dri) permissions via flatseal. After that, spotify works fine again. I would appreciate if that issue could be fixed.
summary: UI does not render with GPU acceleration enabled

J'ai essayé de faire le trie dans les dépendances, update mais rien à faire.

Si l'appli ne se lance pas (écran noir), comme chez moi depuis début novembre (fedora 38 et 39), il faut la supprimer puis la réinstaller via flathub. Ouvrir le terminal, puis copier/coller : 
flatpak install flathub com.spotify.Client

В связи с текущий ситуацией в России пришлось создать новый аккаунт через VPN Индии. В этой стране в споти нет рекламы, нет ограничений на пропуск треков, а так же работает Spotify Connect, то есть переключение воспроизведения между другими устройствами. Учтите, что каждые 2 недели вас будет выкидывать из аккаунта и нужно будет заново логиниться через VPN Индии, в остальное время используйте сервис без VPN, как обычно. Так же можете попробовать создать новый аккаунт через Великобританию.

Для плашек подобной смене языка - шелкайте мышкой, после нажимайте Enter. Для того чтобы убрать facebook, снимите галку с пункта (Показывать действия друзей).
